body.name: Asylum: Star Kingdom, Book 9
body.description: A young woman with cybernetic upgrades, Mari Moonrazor has decided to flee the restrictive machine-worshipping cult she was raised in. She longs to know what it’s like to live among normal humans and experience simple biological pleasures like consuming alcohol, kissing a boy, and — most importantly — eating chocolate.But her mother, the infamous astroshaman leader Kyla Moonrazor, is determined to get her back, even if it means sending a bounty hunter after her. Mari’s only hope for freedom is to be granted asylum from the leaders of the powerful Star Kingdom. First, she must prove that she has knowledge and resources she can offer them. Second, she has to earn their trust.This all would have been easier if her people hadn’t bombed their planet....Asylum is a stand-alone novel in the Star Kingdom universe. It introduces new heroes, but fans will enjoy visits with Casmir, Kim, Qin, Laser, Oku, and other favorites from the series. Read more

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Hopefully just the beginning
reviews.reviewText: We meet a couple new characters in the Star Kingdom universe, and they quickly became favorites as they interact and adventure with the stars of the series. I'm hoping we see a lot more of Kenji and Mari, as well as more of the world with Oku and Casmir in charge.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars More Kenji and Mari!
reviews.reviewText: I loved this - so fun to see the original characters doing their thing, from the point of view of new ones! And I really like Kenji and Mari! I would LOVE more books asap. I’m running out of Lindsay Buroker books I haven’t read yet!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Another great read and fantastic happy ending.
reviews.reviewText: Another great read. I love happy endings and it looks like everyone for the most part has achieved. I would love to see these characters revisited in future writings. I’m saddened to reach the end of this series but look forward to reading more of Lindsay’s work.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Superb addendum to Star Kingdom
reviews.reviewText: This is a wonderful addendum novel to the Star Kingdom series. All of our old beloved characters make appearances and we are introduced to two new wonderful quirky misfit characters. Yes, Lindsay, we would LOVE more books about Kenji and Mari! And/or any of the Star Kingdom characters.I am sad to finish Star Kingdom. I love love love all of the characters, but, of course, especially Casmir. I've already started my second Buroker series (Dragon Gate) and am thoroughly enjoying it. Anything written by Lindsay Buroker is a must read for a great great time!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 1, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Lindsay Buroker is really hitting her stride with this latest Star Kingdom Novel.
reviews.reviewText: While I do not usually write book reviews, I greatly enjoyed the original series and had hoped that she would write more and while I primarily enjoyed Casmir and his Crusher and would still enjoy more novels featuring him the new characters are Quite interesting and enjoyable along with much more humor. The main event really is not hard to figure out but is also fun. I assume that Kay will be the new Zee. There was a surprising twist in the story involving DNA. While the story was very different from what I expected I was not disappointed. I would highly recommend her SciFi books and while her Fantasy books are surely well written as well for personal and religious reasons I will never buy any of them. My original introduction to this author thru her Fallen empire series and woul love to read more of that series with the original characters rather than the children although those books are very good I really enjoyed the cyborg and mouthy pilot. I would buy any books on their further adventures. So excellent books the author has an amazing vocabulary it is exceedingly rare for me to read books that have words that I am unfamiliar with not that there is enough of that to interfere with one's enjoyment of her books. Please write more.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 4, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Wow, what a fine ending for the series.
reviews.reviewText: The characters are wonderful and quirky. The world building is superb. The plot is twisty and intense. I hope the author will write more books in this universe.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great storyline and adventure.
reviews.reviewText: The meeting of the heroes started out humorous. The female hero was handled very well, showing the lack of human knowledge realistically. The male hero seemed at the same time skilled and quite unaware of human interactions. Why isn't there fake skin? I look forward to more adventures of the team and their further romantic growth.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fantastic addendum to
reviews.reviewText: The Star Kingdom series! Can't wait for more in this vein. Expanding this segment of TSK series would flesh out the storyline in ways that I can only imagine! More Lindsey More!!!.
What a great story!I really enjoyed these new characters as they developed, and would be excited for more stories as they continue to work together!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great to see them all again
reviews.reviewText: Lovely book. Great cameos from all the favorites from the main books snd a fresh new story arc. Couldn't ask for more.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on August 11, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Darn, You have got me hooked on more of your characters. Now you realise you are going to have to satisfy that addiction by writing more about Mari and Kenji. Don't forget Qin and her Sisters too. You are going to be busy Lyndsey.Did I mention Junkyard is howling for more books about his adventures too 😉To paraphrase; feed us, feed us NOW!😂😊
I like tounge in cheek style.Love more on Kenji and Mari.When is the next Casmir Rache book due.

Having finished the other books about the Star Kingdom was glad to find this one which lived up to my expectations. The new characters blend in well with the older ones and I look forward to seeing what happens next
